programme.title: UFC 292: Sterling vs. O'Malley - Prelims
programme.desc: Brad Katona vs. Cody Gibson, bantamweight (TUF Final); Austin Hubbard vs. Kurt Holobaugh, lightweight (TUF Final); Gregory Rodrigues vs. Denis Tiuliulin, middleweight; Chris Weidman vs. Brad Tavares, middleweight. From TD Garden in Boston.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: 2023 Corgi Races at the Emerald Downs
programme.desc: Corgis from throughout the Pacific Northwest will be at Emerald Downs Racetrack in Auburn, Wash., for the annual Corgi Races. There will be six heats with the top two finishers in each heat qualifying for the Championship race.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight: Sunday Night Countdown
programme.desc: Leading into each of ESPN's Sunday Night Baseball telecasts is this special edition of "Baseball Tonight." Host Karl Ravech teams with analysts and reporters to present fans a detailed preview of the network's exclusive, national game of the week. Highlights of the day's other games, interviews with players and managers, and key storylines from around the league also fill the hourlong show. Mark Teixeira, Eduardo Pérez, Tim Kurkjian and Buster Olney are among the analysts.

programme.desc: From Muncy Bank Ballpark at Historic Bowman Field in Williamsport, Pa.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: Monday Night Countdown
programme.desc: Previewing the Monday Night Football matchup airing later on ESPN. Booger McFarland, Robert Griffin III, and Adam Schefter analyze every last morsel of information pertaining to Monday night's combatants, plus discuss the latest news that developed out of Sunday's action.

programme.title: NFL Football
programme.desc: From FedExField in Landover, Md.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: College GameDay Featured

programme.title: College Football Live
programme.desc: Want to know up-to-the-minute reports about your favorite college football team? ESPN has it covered with this weekday studio show, a roundtable format that emphasizes discussion and opinions on the sport's biggest stories and newsmakers. The half-hour program features a rotating roster of analysts that includes coaches, former players, and media personalities.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Daily Wager
programme.desc: Doug Kezirian joins sports betting experts as well as ESPN analysts and reporters from various sports for discussion centered on analytics and point spreads as well as how the day's sports news affects betting.

programme.desc: Sweden is up against Australia at Brisbane Stadium in the third-place playoff of the 2023 World Cup. Sweden can finish third for the fourth time in nine editions of the World Cup. This is already Australia's best performance at the tournament.

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup Highlights
programme.desc: Highlights from the FIFA Women's World Cup, hosted by Australia and New Zealand.

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Australia faces England at Accor Stadium in Sydney in the semifinals of the 2023 World Cup. England's only defeat in its 38 matches under Sarina Wiegman was a 2-0 friendly loss versus Australia at Gtech Community Stadium in London on April 11, 2023.

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Spain is up against Sweden at Eden Park in Auckland in the semifinals of the 2023 World Cup. Sweden is unbeaten in all 11 matches against Spain, including a 1-0 victory in Karlskoga in the group stage of EURO 1997 (own goal by Judith Corominas).

programme.desc: West-leading St. Louis City SC return to MLS action by facing Austin FC. The Texan side was the first MLS team to fall to the expansion club as Klauss scored in the 86th minute to give St. Louis a 3-2 victory in its competitive debut Feb. 25.

programme.desc: The No. 4 Horned Frogs (10-0, 7-0 Big 12) try to remain perfect when they face the Bears (6-4, 4-3). TCU continued to build its case for a playoff spot by beating then-No. 18 Texas 17-10 on Nov. 12. TCU won six of the last seven meetings with Baylor.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Longhorns host the No. 1 Crimson Tide. This is the first meeting between the storied programs since Alabama topped Texas 37-21 in the 2010 BCS national championship game. Alabama blanked Utah State on Sept. 3, while Texas beat Louisiana Monroe.

programme.desc: Kareem Abdul-Jabbar talks about the game in which Magic Johnson (triple-double) and Abdul-Jabbar (29 points) proved to be too much for the Celtics, as the Lakers defeated the Celtics in a NBA Finals series for the first time.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Mystics and Wings end their season set. Washington prevailed 75-74 at home in the first meeting of 2023, but Dallas rallied to win two in the Lone Star State by a combined 45 points. Satou Sabally (DAL) averaged 19.7 points in the three contests.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Sun aim to further hinder the Sky's attempts at a late postseason push. Connecticut is 2-0 against Chicago this season, holding the Sky to 72 points per contest. DeWanna Bonner (CON) averaged 23.5 points and seven rebounds in those wins.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Lynx and Storm shift to the Land of 10,000 Lakes for the finale of their home-and-home set. Minnesota won both halves of a similar series in late June, matching its win total against Seattle from the previous four campaigns combined.

programme.title: Courtside Cinema on NBA TV
programme.desc: An extensive look at the 1984 NBA Draft, considered one of the best of all time. Michael Jordan, Hakeem Olajuwon, and Charles Barkley are only a few of the amazing stories that came out of this draft class.

programme.title: Unstoppable: Bernard King
programme.desc: Bernard King reflects on his journey from Brooklyn to Tennessee to an NBA career.

programme.desc: Bernard King scores 60 points against the Nets. From Dec. 25, 1984.

programme.desc: Game 7 of the 1982 Eastern Conference Finals. Julius Erving leads Philadelphia to victory over Boston in a decisive game 7.

programme.title: The Doctor
programme.desc: The definitive look at Julius "Dr. J" Erving's life and career--growing up in New York, playing in the ABA, and winning a NBA championship with the Philadelphia 76ers.

programme.title: Mr. Russell's House
programme.desc: NBA legend Bill Russell talks with Bill Simmons about growing up and playing for the Celtics during the Civil Rights era, Russell's battles with Wilt Chamberlain, and President Obama honoring him with the Presidential Medal of Freedom.

programme.title: Bill Russell: Answer the Call
programme.desc: A look at the legendary presence of the late Bill Russell through heartfelt stories and fond memories from basketball royalty including Jerry West, Julius Erving, Isiah Thomas, Spencer Haywood, Shaquille O'Neal and Kareem Abdul-Jabbar.

programme.title: 1972 NBA Finals
programme.desc: Lakers' center Wilt Chamberlain has 24 points and 29 rebounds to lead the Lakers to their first title since moving to Los Angeles. From May 7, 1972.

programme.desc: Shaquille O'Neal and Kareem Abdul-Jabbar sit down to discuss their relationship and past, as well as how the NBA has evolved.

programme.title: Big Game James: The James Worthy Story
programme.desc: The career of the former Los Angeles Lakers' star.

programme.title: The Big O
programme.desc: The storied career of professional basketball player Oscar Robertson.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: Game 4 of the 1966 Eastern Conference Semifinals. Oscar Robertson scores 34 points against the Celtics.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: East 123, West 112, Oscar Robertson MVP, from Baltimore.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: Game 5 of the 1976 NBA Finals. Suns' Gar Heard forces the game into triple overtime but Boston ends up the victor.

programme.title: Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: Magic Johnson's first game, from Oct. 12, 1979.

programme.title: NB80's
programme.desc: The rivalry between Magic Johnson and Larry Bird; introduction of the 3-point line.

programme.title: NB80's
programme.desc: "Showtime" comes to Los Angeles; Moses Malone wins the elusive NBA title.

programme.title: NB80's
programme.desc: The 1984 NBA Draft, the Celtics and Lakers battle for supremacy, and All-Star Weekend introduces the Slam Dunk Contest.

programme.title: NB80's
programme.desc: Larry Bird and Magic Johnson battle for league and MVP titles; Spud Webb secures a spot in All-Star history; Dr. J says goodbye.

programme.title: NB80's
programme.desc: Lakers win back-to-back titles; Pistons on the verge of dominance; Michael Jordan hits a "shot" to remember.

programme.title: NB90's
programme.desc: Phil Jackson heads to Chicago; the Magic and Timberwolves join the league; Pistons win back-to-back titles; "Inside Stuff" is born; Run TMC takes off; Bulls make their first title run.

programme.title: NB90's
programme.desc: Magic Johnson steals the All-Star show; Clyde Drexler leads Portland back to the Finals but Jordan shrugs them off; Shaq joins the league; Charlotte is a buzz; Sir Charles goes off.

programme.title: NB90's
programme.desc: Michael Jordan tries a new game; Chris Webber is the top rookie; Hakeem Olajuwon makes Houston's dreams come true.

programme.title: NB90's
programme.desc: The NBA goes north of the border; Brent Barry wins the 1996 Dunk Contest; Gary Payton and Shawn Kemp team up in Seattle; the Bulls win 72 games.

programme.title: NB90's
programme.desc: Tim Duncan becomes a Spur; Jazz and Bulls face off in the NBA Finals; Vince Carter takes flight.

programme.title: Clutch City
programme.desc: Commemorating the 20-year anniversary of the Houston Rockets' back-to-back championship seasons. Hakeem Olajuwon, Clyde Drexler, Kenny Smith, Robert Horry, Sam Cassell and Vernon Maxwell reflect on the championship teams.

programme.title: Muggsy: Always Believe
programme.desc: Muggsy Bogues, the shortest player in NBA history, lives by the motto "Always Believe", and that guided him to greater heights than anyone could have predicted, including his rise from Baltimore, to Wake Forest, and ultimately to NBA success.

programme.title: Basketball Stories
programme.desc: From breaking backboards to topping the rap charts, Shaquille O'Neal's rookie season was both dominant and memorable. Patrick Ewing, Alonzo Mourning, Charles Barkley, and many more share stories and highlights of Shaq's first year in the NBA.

programme.title: Rip City Revival
programme.desc: The untold stories behind the 1989-92 Portland Trail Blazers -- a small market team that defied expectations and made two NBA Finals.

programme.title: Basketball Stories: Sir Charles & The Doctor
programme.desc: Two members of the NBA 75th Anniversary Team - Charles Barkley and Julius "Dr. J." Erving - are featured in this basketball documentary.

programme.title: Reign Man & the Glove
programme.desc: A look back at the dynamic chemistry between Shawn Kemp and Gary Payton, the iconic duo that wowed NBA fans in the 1990s with their remarkable displays of alley-oops, dunks and defense.

programme.title: Basketball Stories
programme.desc: Isiah Thomas sits down with Karl The Mailman Malone as they discuss his Hall of Fame career.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Mystics host the traveling Sun. Connecticut has won nine of the past 10 meetings with Washington, including all three battles this season. Four-time All-Star Alyssa Thomas (CON) is averaging 19.3 points and 11.7 rebounds in those 2023 victories.
